New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in MLB history to have 40 home runs and 70 stolen bases in a single season
Key Match Events: The game was decided in the 10th inning by Ozzie Albies' base hit that scored Ronald Acuña Jr. for the winning run
Post-Match Reflections: Ronald Acuña Jr. scored the game-winning run and celebrated with his teammates, creating a playoff atmosphere
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Atlanta Braves surpassed 3 million in attendance for the second consecutive season
Others: The Chicago Cubs' playoff hopes were jeopardized with a loss, falling into a tie for the wild card
